item.title: Kurt add a quote by Emerson, Ralph Waldo
item.description: "I cannot remember the books I've read any more than the meals I have eaten; even so, they have made me." -- Emerson, Ralph Waldo

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "It is the preoccupation with possessions, more than anything else that prevents us from living freely and nobly." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "Growth for the sake of growth is the ideology of the cancer cell." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "From the point of view of a tapeworm, man was created by God to serve the appetite of the tapeworm." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Kurt add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "There are two ways to get enough. One is to continue to accumulate more and more. The other is to desire less." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "There are some good things to be said about walking. Not many, but some. Walking takes longer, for example, than any other known form of locomotion except crawling. Thus it stretches time and prolongs life. Life is already too short to waste on speed. I have a friend who's always in a hurry; he never gets anywhere. Walking makes the world much bigger and thus more interesting. You have time to observe the details. The utopian technologists foresee a future for us in which distance is annihilated. â€¦ To be everywhere at once is to be nowhere forever, if you ask me." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Kurt add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "So we beat on, boats against the current, borne back ceaselessly into the past." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kurt add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Norman Maclean
item.description: "Eventually, all things merge into one, and a river runs through it. The river was cut by the world's great flood and runs over rocks from the basement of time. On some of the rocks are timeless raindrops. Under the rocks are the words, and some of the words are theirs. I am haunted by waters." -- Norman Maclean

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Norman Maclean
item.description: "In our family, there was no clear line between religion and fly fishing. We lived at the junction of great trout rivers in western Montana, and our father was a Presbyterian minister and a fly fisherman who tied his own flies and taught others. He told us about Christ's disciples being fishermen, and we were left to assume, as my brother and I did, that all first-class fishermen on the Sea of Galilee were fly fishermen and that John, the favorite, was a dry-fly fisherman." -- Norman Maclean

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Malcolm Forbes
item.description: "The true measure of a man is how he treats someone who can do him absolutely no good." -- Malcolm Forbes

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I have never found a companion that was so companionable as solitude." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Norman Maclean
item.description: "Each one of us here today will at one time in our lives look upon a loved one who is in need and ask the same question: We are willing to help, Lord, but what, if anything, is needed? For it is true we can seldom help those closest to us. Either we don't know what part of ourselves to give or, more often than not, the part we have to give is not wanted. And so it is those we live with and should know who elude us. But we can still love them - we can love completely without complete understanding." -- Norman Maclean

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "A man on foot, on horseback or on a bicycle will see more, feel more, enjoy more in one mile than the motorized tourists can in a hundred miles." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Eagles
item.description: "You call someplace paradise, kiss it goodbye" -- Eagles

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Eagles
item.description: "We satisfy our endless needs and justify our bloody deeds in the name of destiny and in the name of God." -- Eagles

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Supertramp
item.description: "Watch what you say! They'll be calling you a radical, a liberal, a fanatical criminal." -- Supertramp

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Jesse Ventura
item.description:
"You give me a water board, Dick Cheney and one hour, and I'll have him confess to the Sharon Tate murders."
(<i>Larry King Live</i>, May 11, 2009)" -- Jesse Ventura

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Kurt add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "If you're not careful, the newspapers will have you hating the people who are being oppressed, and loving the people who are doing the oppressing." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Alexis de Tocqueville
item.description: "The American Republic will endure until the day Congress discovers that it can bribe the public with the public's money." -- Alexis de Tocqueville

item.title: Kurt add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "But Noodynaady's actual ingrate tootle is of come into the garner mauve and thy nice are stores of morning and buy me a bunch of iodines. " -- James Joyce

item.title: Kurt add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Twenty years from now you will be more disappointed by the things that you didn't do than by the ones you did do. So throw off the bowlines. Sail away from the safe harbor. Catch the trade winds in your sails. Explore. Dream. Discover." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "The best moments in reading are when you come across something - a thought, a feeling, a way of looking at things - which you had thought special and particular to you. And now, here it is, set down by someone else, a person you have never met, someone even who is long dead. And it is as if a hand has come out, and taken yours" -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Kurt add a quote by Atwood H. Townsend
item.description: "No matter how busy you may think you are, you must find time for reading, or surrender yourself to self-chosen ignorance." -- Atwood H. Townsend
